article.headline: Square acquires Spanish startup as stock trades near 52-week high
article.body: Square Inc. SQ, +2.06% announced Monday that its Cash App unit had acquired Verse, a startup in Spain that offers the ability to send cash between users, as Square shares neared their 52-week high. Square's Cash App also allows for person-to-person transfers of funds, but is only available in the U.S. and UK. In a blog post announcing the acquisition, the company said that it planned to allow Verse to continue operating autonomously in Spain while supporting it with technology and resources. "At this point, our main priority is enabling Verse to continue their successful growth in Europe," the post stated. The San Francisco financial-technology company did not disclose a purchase price for Verse, but a report in Spanish media said the deal was for 30 million to 50 million euros. Square shares were trading near $91 with less than an hour until the close Monday, a gain of nearly 5% on the day and close to Square's 52-week closing high of $91.97. The stock has increased more than 45% so far this year, as the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% has declined more than 5%.
